message.content:
<<<api>>>: DataOutputStream.write
<<<code>>>: private void writeIntToBytes(DataOutputStream dataOutputStream, int value) throws IOException {
    dataOutputStream.write((value >> 24) & 0xFF);
    dataOutputStream.write((value >> 16) & 0xFF);
    dataOutputStream.write((value >> 8) & 0xFF);
    dataOutputStream.write(value & 0xFF);
}
<<<explanation>>>: To expand an integer into 4 bytes, you can use the DataOutputStream.write method to write each byte individually. The code snippet provided above demonstrates how to do this. The value is shifted right by 24, 16, 8, and 0 bits respectively, and then the least significant byte is written using the bitwise AND operator. This ensures that only the least significant byte is written and the rest are ignored.
